Day 2 of Nordic Circular Summit 2025 launched a powerful new initiative: the Nordic-Baltic Textile Transition Group.

8 countries. One platform. One mission: build regional textile circularity.

Key insight from Kerli Kant Hvass (Aalborg University): "No single market has scaled feedstock volumes or technology mix available to build a circular textile system alone."

The Nordic-Baltic region has complementary strengths:
- Nordics: Design, R&D, emerging sorting/recycling tech
- Baltics: Production, manual sorting expertise, reuse/repair capacity

Alone, each country struggles. Together, we have the scale and diversity for systemic change.

This is what regional collaboration looks like: not competition, but coordination.

#NordicCircularSummit #TextileCircularity #NordicBaltic #RegionalCollaboration

"The most sustainable building is the one that is kept in use and loved."

Day 2 of Nordic Circular Summit introduced the Building Hierarchy Triangle:

2Ô∏è‚É£ Then: Prolong lifetime with maintenance
3Ô∏è‚É£ If needed: Renovate and transform
4Ô∏è‚É£ If more space needed: Extend existing
5Ô∏è‚É£ Only then: Build new

The numbers are stark:
- Norway: 200,000+ unused buildings in districts
- Denmark: Must reduce new construction 80% by 2030 to meet goals
- Norway: Must reduce material use 72% by 2030

We don't need to build our way to sustainability. We need to use what we already have.

#CircularConstruction #BuildingHierarchy #Retrofit #NordicCircularSummit

Day 2 insight from Nordic Circular Summit:

"Competing brands that would not in a million years sit together 5 years ago‚Äîthey're actually quite willing to sit together."

Pre-competitive collaboration = Nordic superpower.

40 Danish companies. Annual reporting. Shared learning.

#CircularEconomy

From Estonia: A 15-tool Circular Design Toolbox, now open-source for the entire Nordic-Baltic region.

HI Advisory presented their framework at Nordic Circular Summit Day 2:

üìä Self-assessment questionnaire
üîç 6 tools to UNDERSTAND your current state
üéØ 3 tools to DEFINE your value proposition
üí° 3 tools to IDEATE solutions
üöÄ 3 tools to DEVELOP implementation

Key concept: The Circularity Ladder
- Level 1: Conventional (no initiative)
- Level 2: Green (circularity = waste management)
- Level 3: Sustainable (goal but not in business model)
- Level 4: Restorative (core of business model)
- Level 5: Regenerative (give back more than take)

As Dan Mikkin put it: "If it adds up, it all makes sense. If it doesn't, then it's a charity project."

Circular economy needs viable business models, not just good intentions.

Toolbox available via Enterprise Estonia. Free. Open-source.

#CircularDesign #BusinessModel #Toolbox #NordicCircularSummit #Estonia

Iceland's circular construction insight:

"Living in a small, agile society meant experimentation felt possible. Things can happen really quickly if right conditions align."

Small scale = rapid learning.

Iceland's Hamkrid project: hempcrete building within regulatory loophole. Innovation at the margins.

#CircularConstruction

The data gap is a circular economy gap.

Three revelations from Nordic Circular Summit Day 2:

üáÆüá∏ Iceland: No official statistics on building material imports since 2010
üßµ Textiles: "We found quite fragmented‚Äîlots of reports. We don't have that consolidated, excellent overview."
üèóÔ∏è Construction: "I haven't found one politician who can say, we're going to be this much circular to achieve our goals."

Without data:
- Policies can't be designed
- Progress can't be measured
- Investment cases can't be made

The Danish textile sector collaboration shows the way: 40 companies reporting annually in consistent format. Data collection builds trust. Trust enables collaboration.

Data isn't bureaucracy. It's infrastructure.

#DataDriven #CircularEconomy #PolicyDesign #NordicCircularSummit

Nordic Circular Summit Day 2:

Denmark must reduce new construction 80% by 2030.
Norway must reduce material use 72% by 2030.

Yet regulations still favor linear production.

"The regulations are being challenged, but they are still very much favoring the linear way."

Policy reform = urgent priority.

#CircularEconomy

"We can collaborate only when you have trust. Trust doesn't happen itself."
‚Äî Kerli Kant Hvass, Aalborg University

Day 2 of Nordic Circular Summit reinforced Day 1's insight: trust is infrastructure.

In textiles: Pre-competitive collaboration enabled 40 competing Danish brands to share data and learnings.

In construction: Nordic Sustainable Construction Network coordinates government policy across 5+ countries.

In design: Open-source tools shared freely across region.

Trust-building takes time:
- ACT Cluster: 8 years
- Cesis bioregion memorandum: 1 year
- Danish textile collaboration: 3 years and growing

But without trust, circular systems cannot function. Materials must flow across company boundaries. Data must be shared. Competitors must collaborate.

Invest in trust infrastructure before physical infrastructure.

#TrustAsInfrastructure #Collaboration #CircularEconomy #NordicCircularSummit

Iceland built with turf for 900 years‚Äîbiodegradable structures that returned to earth when no longer needed.

Then: 80% concrete in 100 years.

Now: Asking "if concrete brought Iceland to modernity, what brings us into a regenerative future?"

Look back to move forward.

#CircularConstruction #Iceland

Nordic Circular Summit Day 2 launched three concrete initiatives:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Nordic-Baltic Textile Transition Group
- 8 countries coordinating textile circularity
- Steering committee established
- Riga conference planned for summer 2026

2Ô∏è‚É£ Nordic Circular Construction Product Catalog
- Currently: 15 verified circular solutions

- Goal: Make circular products as accessible as conventional

3Ô∏è‚É£ Circular Design Toolbox
- 15 tools from understanding to implementation

These aren't plans‚Äîthey're operating infrastructure.

Day 1 set the vision. Day 2 provided the tools.

Implementation is the priority. The region is ready.

#NordicCircularSummit #Implementation #CircularEconomy #NordicBaltic

EPR for textiles: high hopes, low fees.

"Fees are unrealistically low. Targets are missing, unclear and unambiguous."

If EPR doesn't fund proper collection, sorting, and recycling, it's just greenwashing infrastructure.

Nordic-Baltic alignment needed urgently.

#EPR #TextileCircularity

15 tools. 4 stages. Several months.

Estonian Circular Design Toolbox: step-by-step from understanding to implementation.

"A good efficient transition process usually takes 5-7 tools over several months."

Not overnight transformation. Systematic transition.

Free. Open-source.

#CircularDesign

The textile waste hierarchy is broken.

Day 2 of Nordic Circular Summit revealed:

üî¥ Collection: Everyone collects, but bottlenecks everywhere
üü° Sorting for Reuse: Baltics strong, Nordics export most
üü† Local Reuse: Growing but underinvested
üîµ Preparation for Reuse: "Has not received much attention"
üü£ Recycling: Nordics pioneering, but capacity limited

Key finding: "A lot of products don't get reused because they're dirty, have stains, have pilling‚Äîthese activities are not done professionally at scale."

We focus on high-tech recycling while ignoring simple repair and cleaning.

Inner loops first. Recycling last.

The waste hierarchy exists for a reason‚Äîhonor it.

#WasteHierarchy #TextileCircularity #PreparationForReuse #InnerLoops

From Day 2:

"Regenerative organizations are these rare pioneering companies which give back more than they take from nature and society."

Level 5 on the Circularity Ladder.

Not just less bad. Actually good.

From extraction to regeneration. The real goal.

#Regenerative #CircularEconomy
